div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 20px; margin-left: 294px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: API request for all clincial trials from clinical trials.gov

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.div: Use matchminer to convert to ctml (might be able to skip clinical trials.gov if matchminer has a list of all clinical trials itself.

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.div: Filter out only Cancer clinical trials

div.div: store list of requirements for each clinical trial and the valid patient data which would let them participate. this could be some type of dictionary of sorts

switch.text: store list of requirements for each...

div.div: Update list of clinical trials and their requirements (may be done periodically instead in the future)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 538px; margin-left: 64px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.div: Find entropy of data set after having acquired each possible patient property

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 138px; height: 1px; padding-top: 538px; margin-left: 224px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Determine the question which has the most information gain based on the entropy (we could look for max entropy which would most evenly split the remaining trials)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 538px; margin-left: 394px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Use an LLM to acquire the patient property. (use the type of prompt I had used before to acquire information)
This will result in a loop that will only break once the user provides the information or can't acquiire the information themselves to provide it. the LLM will not take not understanding the property as a valid answer, instead it will explain

switch.text: Use an LLM to acquire the patient...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 538px; margin-left: 614px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Update list of clincial trials which are still available after taking previous answer into account

div.div: Are there any clincial trials left?

div.div: Have you asked all of the questions?

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 189px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1015px; margin-left: 283px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.div: Use an LLM to Inform the patient of the remaining clinical trials which appear to be suitable. Remind them that they still need to visit a medical facility to be sure.

switch.text: Use an LLM to Inform the patient...
